alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Monroe; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact southeastern La Crosse, northwestern Vernon and southwestern Monroe Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stoddard, or 10 miles south of La Crosse, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 mph, half inch hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in a short while that could cause rapid rises in creeks and streams. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coon Valley around 310 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Mount La Crosse, County Roads G And H, Brinkman Ridge, Jersey Valley County Park, Portland, South Side Of La Crosse, Esofea, Goose Island, Highways 14 61 And County M M, and The Coulee Experimental Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
